intro: Macairea goyazensis, commonly known as the Goyazensis macairea, is a flowering plant native to the Brazilian state of Mato Grosso. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
